Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain as executive chairman and will advise Page and Sergey Brin , Google Inc. 's other co-founder. Sergey Brin will give up his title as co-president to work on high-priority projects.

As ever, only time will tell whether or not Eric Schmidt 's reasons of simplifying management structure and speeding up decision making are akin to Alan Johnson's "personal reasons" for quitting his job as shadow chancellor, but most right-minded people are likely to be leaning in the direction of not.

According to the Morning News, Dwaine Caraway on Tuesday told Dallas sports radio station 1310 AM that he honored Michael Vick because he thinks the quarterback can be a role model for kids. These kids are the future, and we don't have enough folks out here joining hands and turning lives around, Dwaine Caraway said, according to the newspaper. in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball.
